text:
Hi guys! Could you help me -- *how to add a contact to the deal* ?
And I send a request, but receive an uninformative error (_request/response on the screenshot_)
also I tried in docs

:white_check_mark: resolved))) used api v3 like this
`/crm/v3/objects/deals/12345678/associations/contacts/101/deal_to_contact`

Good morning! Is there a way to get a blanket list of associations as tabular data for stuff like SQL joins? I tried called
```<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v4/associations/Deals/Companies/labels>```
just as is, and it spits back a null (with my API key appended on the end ofc).
This message was deleted.

I have this basic query that I am using to query contacts (/crm/v3/objects/contacts). I would like to add a filter that request only contacts that are associated with an Active company. Is that possible?

Hi Andreas - thank you for your reply.
The problem is not support, the problem is that HubSpot is removing the Doctype - making all mobile devices render the email as the desktop version
Hi, I was just coming to ask the same thing. Thanks for the reply. I think the v4 documentation is wrong or I don't understand it. In general I understand it less than v3
You can always call the schemas endpoint (`crm/v3/schemas/deals`) to see all the association types ids for deals (the association info will all be at the bottom of the request past the property info)
thanks!
For sure, let me know if you need any help getting it setup
<@U01DQL7AMFH> - Thanks for sharing! I’m submitting your feedback, but I might come back with more questions!

Hello! I've been reading over HubSpot's docs but I can't seem to find a straight forward answer. I'm trying to use an api call to extract object data to a gzip csv format in order to send it to s3. Can someone confirm this is possible? And let me know which native api to use?

<@U0119K7L12Q> did you try using the contact search endpoint instead? you can search through associations that way
`<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search#search-through-associations>`
I am using this endpoint... /crm/v3/objects/contacts
so it's just associated with a company in general
:arrow_up: Yep, just like Tim says you can't run this query using the /crm/v2/objects/contacts endpoint
I'm a little confused, what exactly do you mean by "Active company"
No not natively
You could build your own api through ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
Hey <@U01QVR44MEY> Yes, the goal is to build the api. I'm not a developer, my development team wanted to know if it was possible. Maybe using ruby or python?
Personally I would use node but anything will work
cool, thank you for the info!
hi, im currently using the search API to obtain deals. I am noticing that some deals are returning an empty create date value, is this a bug or can a deal actually not have a create date?
this is the endpoint that im using: <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals/search>
here is a snippet of the raw api response:
I have never seen this before. would you try running this query and reporting back the data you get:
